1085210844483457024.text:
Ahead of the upcoming #Constantinople hardfork, please make sure that your contract doesn't become vulnerable to reentrancy attacks due to the lowered gas costs.

Great work by the @chain_security team:https://medium.com/chainsecurity/constantinople-enables-new-reentrancy-attack-ace4088297d9 …

1080291038470627328.text: 1/ It's easy to underestimate the sheer amount of talent working on solutions to Ethereum's challenges. The smart contract security community alone has grown to hundreds of devs and researchers.

1076096502005727234.text: Cryptocurrency value comes both from the protocol and the social layer - great explanation by @hasuflhttps://medium.com/@hasufly/bitcoins-social-contract-1f8b05ee24a9 …

1061231857516363776.text:
Smart contract audits need to include much more detail on scope and specification. What's useful to users is to know what has been checked and certified. Violations / vulnerabilities are mostly for developers to fix.

@chain_security @ZeppelinOrg @trailofbits @ConsenSys

1062356819778134016.text: NDAs are bad for crypto security. If you’re creating an open source protocol why would I sign an NDA as a security auditor when I audit it? The results of an audit for an open source project should be open source too.

1059784399959527424.text: We enjoyed auditing @BokkyPooBah's red black binary tree and EIP 777 and talking with @sigp_io @Quantstamp, @SolidStamp, BeakerOS and others. Thanks for participating in Solidified CTF and thanks to @web3foundation for hosting!pic.twitter.com/J5ahNfejtx

1058724685289021441.text: What differs #devcon from other conferences I attended is that there is really no distinction between the organizers and the audience. It’s really the attendees who provide all the event content and shape the future of the whole ecosystem, not some central authority #Devcon4

1024883718165475329.text: I expected #DWebSummit to have a one big stage so that I can sit in one place and watch all the talks. Instead each session is in a different room, there are several lunch spots and two registration areas. Everything is decentralized. Medium is the message.

Not sure whether to laugh or cry :)) FoMo3d contract on #Ethereum mainnet ($12M) being exit scammed due to their buggy code ;) For now only the airdrops are nuked.

1047421592182149120.text: SolidStamp smart contracts have been audited by @matthewdif as a part of the ZK Labs Community Audits! Thank you @zklabs for the initiative.https://twitter.com/matthewdif/status/1044851829807468545 …

1047121883223724032.text: 3. We allow auditors to upload their reports and their metadata to SolidStamp. The data is cryptographically signed and the reports are stored on IPFS. Anyone can confirm the authenticity of an audit and read its content even if it is not available at its original location.

1047121881499865089.text: 2. We allow regular users to find all the contracts they interact with to see which are audited and stamped and who audited them: https://www.solidstamp.com/account/

1047121880203890688.text: 1. Starting today, auditors can stamp the audited contract and signal that the deployed code has fixed any critical issues from the audits. These stamps are stored on-chain, connecting the auditor, the contract and the audit report (through the IPFS hash) forever.

1016709069388775424.text: We analyzed 13 companies, 149 audits and 188 addresses. Our report methodology and raw data is available at https://www.solidstamp.com/blog/solidstamp-smart-contract-auditor-report-july-2018 …. Any feedback or suggestions? Let us know how we can improve the next edition of our report.

1008633360984440832.text: We are happy to announce the launch of SolidStamp @SolidStamp - an on-chain registry of Ethereum smart contract audits. We connect smart contract users and security auditors to ensure the safety of their ethers and tokens. #BUIDL https://www.solidstamp.com/blog/solidstamp-putting-skin-in-the-blockchain-game …
